text: {{Infobox writer | name = Joan Carreras i Goicoechea | image = Joan Carreras.JPG | image_size = 150px | alt = | caption = Joan Carreras in 2013 | native_name = | native_name_lang = | pseudonym = | birth_name = | birth_date = 1962 | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | resting_place = | occupation = Writer and journalist | language = Catalan | nationality = Catalonia | ethnicity = | citizenship = | education = | alma_mater = | period = | genre = | subject = | movement = | notableworks = Cafè Barcelona | spouse = | partner = | children = | relatives = | awards = | signature = | signature_alt = | years_active = | module = | website = | portaldisp = }} Joan Carreras i Goicoechea (born in Barcelona, 1962) is a Catalan journalist, screenwriter, and writer. He is a professor in the Faculty of Communication at Blanquerna. He teaches digital journalism. He worked for ten years at the broadcasting company Corporació Catalana de Mitjans Audiovisuals. He was the director of Canal 33. He was also the manager of the program Info-K. At television channel 324.cat he tried out new formats and digital narratives. He has also worked for many newspapers, such as Avui, Diari de Barcelona and El Temps. In 2014, he received the Premi Sant Jordi de novel·la for his novel L'àguila negra (The black eagle). == Works == === Story collections === * 1990 — Les oques van descalces (Quaderns Crema) * 1993 — La bassa del gripau (Quaderns Crema) === Novels === * 1998 — La gran nevada (Empúries) * 2003 — Qui va matar el Floquet de Neu (Empúries) * 2009 — L'home d'origami (Amsterdam)Blog oficial del llibre * 2012 — Carretera secundària (Proa) * 2013 — Cafè Barcelona (Proa) * 2015 — L'àguila negra == Awards and honours == * 2012 - Premis Literaris de Cadaqués - Carles Rahola de periodisme.
